p: The number of positive cases increased beyond 553 cases on the 16 th March 2020, and the Prime Minister of Malaysia announced a Movement Control Order (MCO). Social distancing was to be in place for 14 days (18 th March to 31 st March 2020) to reduce the rapid spread of COVID-19 [ 33â€“ 35]. Since the 18 th March 2020, the government restricted people from travelling to other states or COVID-19 affected areas. Only 1 person from 1 family could leave the home and go out to buy essential goods.
